alert.note: Alert for Absaroka, Beartooth Mountains; Beartooth Foothills; Crazy Mountains; Livingston Area; Melville Foothills; Northern Park; Northern Sweet Grass; Paradise Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 03 at 2:06AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...LIGHT TO OCCASIONALLY MODERATE SNOW COULD MAKE ROADS SLICK... An area of light to occasionally moderate snow has set up over the Paradise Valley, extending north and eastward off the Beartooth foothills. This band of snow will gradually decease as morning approaches. Snow accumulation will be light and mainly over grassy surfaces, but a light accumulation of a dusting to an inch, could stick to parts of roadways and make travel slick in spots. Visibility will be briefly reduced to around a mile at times, making travel a little difficult. Motorists are encouraged to use caution. Locations impacted include... Livingston, Big Timber, Clyde Park, Gardiner, Chico Hot Springs, Springdale, Fishtail, Dean, Mc Leod, Pine Creek, Chico, Corwin Springs, Greycliff, Nye, Emigrant and Jardine. The snow can accumulate at a rate of one inch per hour or more in this area of heavy snow. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this area of heavy snow.
